key_title: Key to the species of Vulpia

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lemma margins with cilia 0.5 mm long or more
Lemma margins glabrous, but often scabrous, the outgrowths never to 0.5 mm
Lemma margins ciliate from base to awn
Lemma margins glabrous in lower half

Lemma with a pointed callus, more than 0.5 mm long; overall length of lemma (including awn) more than 25 mm; lower glume c. 1 (rarely to 2) mm long, less than one-tenth as long as long-awned upper glume
Lemma with a rounded callus, less than 0.4 mm long; overall length of lemma mostly less than 25 mm; lower glume more than one-tenth as long as unawned or shortly awned upper glume
Lower glume 2.5–5 mm long, from one-half to three-quarters as long as upper glume
Lower glume 0.5–3 mm long, usually less than one-half as long as upper glume
Panicle usually fully exserted from uppermost leaf-sheath; lower glume from one-quarter to one-half as long as upper glume
Panicle usually not fully exserted from uppermost leaf-sheath; lower glume from one-tenth to four-tenths (but mostly less than one-quarter) as long as upper glume
